title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.001
frontText: What is a cluster?
backText: A group of virtual or physical servers working in conjunction as a distributed system

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.002
frontText: What is block storage?
backText: A storage model that builds on contiguous sets of bytes known as blocks

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.003
frontText: What is the time delay called between sending data and receiving it?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.004
frontText: What is KVM, and what does it do?
backText: The Kernel Virtual Machine provides virtualization in Linux that allows the operating system kernel to function like a hypervisor.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.005
frontText: What is the difference between a virtual machine and a container when it comes to isolating computing resources?
backText: VMs run a guest operating system on a physical server. Containers use features of the host operating system to isolate processes and resources.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.006
frontText: What is the open source platform developed by Google that provides container management services such as deployment and autoscaling functionality?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.007
frontText: What is a persistent disk?
backText: A durable block storage system that can be attached to virtual machines in Compute Engine or Kubernetes Engine

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.008
frontText: What is Cloud SQL?
backText: It is Google Cloud’s managed relational database. It includes MySQL, SQL Server and PostgreSQL.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.009
frontText: What does the Google Cloud service Cloud Armor protect against?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.010
frontText: What are the three levels of the Google Cloud resource hierarchy?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.011
frontText: Which tier of the Google Cloud resource hierarchy contains VMs, persistent disks, and Cloud SQL databases?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.012
frontText: In the context of Google Cloud, what is a role?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.013
frontText: What kind of identity usually has a service account assigned to it?
backText: A VM, a Google Cloud service or application

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.014
frontText: What are the two types of billing accounts?
backText: Self‐serve billing accounts and invoiced billing accounts

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.015
frontText: Which structures can you have more than one of when creating a resource hierarchy?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.016
frontText: What is another name for a running virtual machine?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.017
frontText: When creating an instance, which tier of the hierarchy must contain it?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.018
frontText: Does the Compute Engine Network Admin role have permission to create instances?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.019
frontText: What are the two ways to run containers in Cloud Run?
backText: As Cloud Run Services and Cloud Run Jobs

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.020
frontText: How many control planes does a Kubernetes cluster contain (assuming no high availability features)?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.021
frontText: Is the life cycle of one cloud function dependent on all others?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.022
frontText: When configuring a VM, what does machine type determine?
backText: The number of CPUs and the amount of memory for the VM

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.023
frontText: In which section of the Create An Instance page can you set the preemptible property?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.024
frontText: What Google Cloud virtual machine has protections against rootkit and bootkit malware?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.025
frontText: Can the block size parameter be set when adding additional disk space through Google Cloud Console?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.026
frontText: A VM created using the command gcloud compute instances create ‐‐machine‐type=n1‐standard‐4 web‐server‐1 will have how many CPUs?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.027
frontText: Can you create a single VM instance using Kubernetes Engine?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.028
frontText: When adding a GPU to an instance, should the instance be set to terminate during maintenance?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.029
frontText: What does the command gcloud compute instances describe do?
backText: It produces a sortable list of field names and properties of the instance.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.030
frontText: Which has better performance in numeric intensive processing, GPUs or CPUs?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.031
frontText: Which kind of Kubernetes instance executes workloads?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.032
frontText: What is the smallest computing instance in a Kubernetes cluster called?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.033
frontText: What does the ReplicaSet Kubernetes component do?
backText: It ensures the correct number of pods is running.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.034
frontText: Which Kubernetes Engine feature would you use to maintain availability during a network outage?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.035
frontText: When using Create Deployment from the Cloud Console, can TTL be specified for a deployment?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.036
frontText: What parameters are required when using the cluster resize command?
backText: Cluster size, cluster name, and node pool name

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.037
frontText: When modifying the number of pods in a cluster, is it better to modify deployments or modify pods directly?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.038
frontText: Which service is responsible for managing container images and other service artifacts?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.039
frontText: Which Google Cloud Computing product is a good serverless option for running a set of microservices?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.040
frontText: What is an action that occurs in the Google Cloud that can invoke a Cloud Function called?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.041
frontText: Does SSL generate events that can be triggered using Cloud Functions?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.042
frontText: What types of events are available to Cloud Functions working with Cloud Storage?
backText: Upload or finalize, delete, metadata update, and archive

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.043
frontText: By default, how long does a Cloud Function run before timing out?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.044
frontText: What is a cache?
backText: A high‐speed, random access memory for storing frequently used data. Google Cloud’s Memorystore provides a managed caching service based on Redis and Memcached.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.045
frontText: What is object storage?
backText: A storage system that manages data as objects, such as files. Cloud Storage is an object storage system.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.046
frontText: What is Cloud Storage?
backText: An object storage service provides web access to scalable storage. Objects can be stored in different storage classes providing different levels of durability and access charges.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.047
frontText: What are the four storage classes in Cloud Storage?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.048
frontText: What is regional storage?
backText: A cloud storage class with typically 99.99 percent monthly availability and 99.9 percent availability SLA. Objects are redundantly stored across zones in a region.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.049
frontText: What is multiregional storage?
backText: A class of Cloud Storage that stores objects in at least two separate geographic places that are separated by at least 100 miles. This practice of storing in separate geographic areas is called georedundant storage.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.050
frontText: Which storage classes are good options for infrequently accessed data? One is designed to be accessed once per month, while the other is designed to be accessed once per year.
backText: Nearline (once per month) and Archive (once per year)

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.051
frontText: Which Cloud Storage class has the lowest per gigabyte charge?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.052
frontText: What is a bucket in terms of Cloud Storage?
backText: A container for holding objects in Cloud Storage. Bucket names are unique across Cloud Storage. Buckets have a geographic location and a storage class. Storage classes are Standard, Nearline, Coldline, and Archive.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.053
frontText: What kind of database has been the primary form of data storage for decades and supports frequent queries and updates to date?
backText: Relational databases, such as Cloud SQL and Cloud Spanner

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.054
frontText: What is BigQuery?
backText: A petabyte‐scale data warehousing and analytics processing managed service that uses relational tables to organize data and SQL as the query language

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.055
frontText: What kind of databases do not use the relational model and do not require a fixed structure or schema?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.056
frontText: What is Cloud Firestore?
backText: A serverless, managed NoSQL document database used for storing, synchronizing, and querying mobile and web application data

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.057
frontText: What are key factors to keep in mind when choosing a storage solution?
backText: Read and write patterns, consistency, transaction support, cost, and latency

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.058
frontText: When using versioning on a bucket, what is the latest version of the object called?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.059
frontText: What managed database services in Google Cloud are used for relational, transaction‐oriented applications?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.060
frontText: What kind of data model is used by Firestore?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.061
frontText: Which Google Cloud database service includes features to support mobile applications?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.062
frontText: What kind of bucket storage class cannot be changed to another class once it is set?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.063
frontText: What are jobs in BigQuery?
backText: Processes used to load, export, copy, and query data. They are automatically created when you start any of these operations.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.064
frontText: What command is used to create a backup of a Cloud SQL database?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.065
frontText: What query language is used by Firestore?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.066
frontText: When estimating the cost of running a BigQuery query, what two services within the Google Cloud will you need to use?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.067
frontText: According to Google best practices, how often should you update virtual machine packages using apt‐get on your created Cloud Spanner instance and database?
backText: Never. Cloud Spanner is a managed service.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.068
frontText: What command is used to create buckets in Cloud Storage?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.069
frontText: Assuming you have Cloud SDK installed, what command would you use to copy files from your local device to a bucket in Cloud Storage?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.070
frontText: After Firestore exports a namespace to a bucket, the bucket will contain what?
backText: A metadata file and a folder with the data

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.071
frontText: Is the file format YAML supported when importing data into BigQuery?
backText: No. However, CSV, Parquet, and Avro are supported.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.072
frontText: What other Google Cloud service does Cloud Spanner use when importing and exporting?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.073
frontText: What is the correct command for importing to Dataproc?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.074
frontText: To ensure you have installed beta gcloud commands, which command should you run?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.075
frontText: What is a virtual private cloud (VPC)?
backText: A logical organization of cloud resources isolated from other resources on the same cloud. In Google Cloud, VPCs are created for projects. Resources in different projects can communicate over Shared VPCs or VPC Peering.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.076
frontText: What is a subnet?
backText: A subnet identifies a range of IP addresses available for hosts on a segment of a network. This IP address range is broken up into the network portion and the host portion. In Google Cloud subnets are regional.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.077
frontText: What is a virtual private network (VPN)?
backText: A secure connection used to link Google Cloud networks on on‐premises networks

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.078
frontText: How do you control the flow of traffic between subnets in a VPC?
backText: By using firewall rules, which are applied to the subnets

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.079
frontText: When you are creating a new VPC and want subnets to learn global routes, which parameter would you set?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.080
frontText: What is the command to create a new VPC from the command line?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.081
frontText: When creating a subnet, which option controls whether logs are sent to Cloud Logging?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.082
frontText: At what level of the resource hierarchy can a Shared VPC be created?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.083
frontText: If you want to define a firewall rule that applies to all destination addresses, what IP address would you specify?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.084
frontText: When creating a VPN using the Cloud Console, what section of the Cloud Console should you use?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.085
frontText: When using gcloud to create a VPN, what three commands would you use?
backText:
These are the three commands:
gcloud compute target-vpn-gateways
gcloud compute forwarding-rule
gcloud compute vpn-tunnels

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.086
frontText: What is load balancing?
backText: The process of distributing workload across a set of servers

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.087
frontText: What three characteristics are load balancers distinguished by?
backText: Global versus regional load balancing, external versus internal load balancing, and the protocols supported

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.088
frontText: What are the five types of load balancers?
backText: HTTP(S), SSL Proxy, TCP Proxy, Internal TCP/UDP, and Network TCP/UDP

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.089
frontText: What is HTTP/HTTPS load balancing?
backText: A global load balancer available in Google Cloud. It is used to load‐balance HTTP and HTTPS traffic.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.090
frontText: What command is used to create a DNS zone in the command line?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.091
frontText: Which regional load balancer allows for load balancing based on IP protocol, address, and port?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.092
frontText: What component(s) need to be configured when creating a TCP Proxy load balancer?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.093
frontText: What is Deployment Manager?
backText: The GPC service for creating resources using a configuration file made up of resource specifications defined in YAML syntax

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.094
frontText: What command launches a deployment?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.095
frontText: What is Identity Access Management (IAM)?
backText: A Google Cloud service for implementing fine‐grained access controls on resources. IAM implements predefined and custom roles that are more narrowly tailored than older, basic roles.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.096
frontText: What is a service account in Google Cloud?
backText: A form of identity that is owned by an application or virtual machine. Service accounts can be assigned roles to enable the application or virtual machine to perform some task.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.097
frontText: What are the three types of roles?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.098
frontText: How do you view roles assigned to identities?
backText: Use the Roles tab in the IAM & Admin section of the console to get a list of identities assigned to particular roles. You can also use gcloud projects get‐iam‐policy to list roles assigned to users in a project.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.099
frontText: IAM roles include a collection of what?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.100
frontText: What is the gcloud command to create a custom role?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.101
frontText: What is Cloud Operations?
backText: A set of services for monitoring, logging, tracing, and debugging infrastructure and applications in Google Cloud and other platforms

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.102
frontText: How long does Cloud Logging store log data?

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.103
frontText: What do you need to specify when defining a custom metric?
backText: A type name, a project, a display name and description, a metric kind, metric labels, and monitored resource objects to include with time‐series data points

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.104
frontText: Do you need to configure or deploy servers to use Cloud Logging?
backText: No. Logging is a managed service.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.105
frontText: What is a log sink?
backText: A storage source outside of Cloud Logging for retaining logs greater than Cloud Logging’s 30‐day retention period. Log sinks can be Cloud Storage buckets, BigQuery data sets, and Cloud Pub/Sub topics.

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.106
frontText: What is Cloud Trace?
backText: A distributed tracing system for collecting latency data from an application, which helps developers understand where applications are spending their time and identify cases where performance is degrading

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.107
frontText: What is Cloud Debug?
backText: An application debugger for inspecting the state of a running program, which allows developers to insert log statements or take snapshots of the state of an application

title: fc871446.GoCCACESG2E.108
frontText: What is alert fatigue, and why is it a problem?
backText: Too many alert notifications are sent for events that do not require human intervention, and eventually DevOps engineers begin to pay less attention to notifications.
